text: To get help in the Instagram app,
tap on your profile icon on the menu bar.
Then the menu icon.
And then select "Settings."
In the settings menu, tap "Help."
And then the help center button.

The help center has a
collection of topics and FAQs

to search through to find
solutions to your problem.
You can access Instagram help support
on a browser as well

by typing Help.instagram.com
into your search bar.
If you're already signed in,
you can also reach the help page

by clicking your profile icon
and selecting "Settings."
Scroll down to the bottom of the page
and click on "Help" in the footer.
This will bring you to the help center,
where you can explore the support topics
for your specific problem.
If you're still having an issue,
you can report a problem to Instagram

and potentially receive a
reply from a representative.

This is the only way you can
speak directly with a human
when resolving an issue.
In help, select "Report a Problem."
The input form will ask you

to provide a brief
description of your issue

as well as providing a
screenshot, if possible.

Once submitted, you
may potentially receive
an email back to follow up,
but it is not guaranteed
you will hear from a human representative.
You can call an automated self-help number
by dialing 650-543-4800.

The voice prompts will
walk through common issues
and try to provide workarounds
similar to the online help center FAQs.

For more help with common
Instagram issues and support,

check out our post linked
in the description below.
